name: Pope Celestine III
summary: Celestine III, born Giacinto Bobone, was Pope from 1191 to 1198. He was one of the oldest popes ever elected, being 85 years old at the time. He crowned Holy Roman Emperor Henry VI. He worked to maintain papal authority and supported the Third Crusade. He had conflicts with King Richard I of England and King Philip II of France. He was the first member of the Orsini family to become pope. His pontificate helped maintain papal power during a period of political complexity.
